summary: Experienced and highly educated professional with a demonstrated history of working and achievements in CBRN Defense field, Non-proliferation of Weapons of Mass Destruction, Health Physics, Crisis Management, Operational Planning, International Relations, and Education and Training. Strong leadership skills demonstrated in leading various arms control, demilitarization, and non-proliferation missions under various International Organizations’ mandates worldwide, including war and conflict zones. Well published author and recognized analyst in the fields of non-proliferation and security. Strong education professional pursuing a PhD program focused in Religion and Security, at University of Tartu, Estonia.

profile_positions.description:
European Union Project 22EL02 - Capacity building to the Ministry for Climate Crisis and Civil Protection: Coordinating Emergency Preparedness, Response and Climate Change Adaptation Actions

On September 6, 2021 the Greek government established the Ministry for Climate Crisis and Civil Protection (MCCCP), holding the responsibilities of the management of natural disasters and crises, as well as dealing with climate change adaptation in Greece.

As CBRN expert I have worked for supporting the elaboration of a National Disaster Risk Management Action Plan. My specific tasks have been:
1.	Provide CBRN inputs for the development of the National Disaster Risk Management Action Plan, in their particular area(s) of expertise.
2.	Support the analysis of the roles and responsibilities of the stakeholders participating at the Working Group-National Disaster Risk Management with regard to the development and future implementation of the National Disaster Risk Management Action Plan. 
3. In addition, as experts I have participated, when was needed, at the WG-NDRM meetings, and provided documentation related to the elaboration of the National Disaster Risk Management Action Plan, for discussion with the WG-NDRM members.

profile_positions.description:
A) Leading relevant types of inspections under Articles IV, V, VI, IX and X of the CWC with specific responsibilities in. 

1. Direct Inspection Planning and Preparation including 
· coordinating all phases of the inspection 
· managing teams of staff., 
· selecting the inspection equipment 
· prepare a written inspection plans.
2. Direct and Oversee all On-site Mission related Activities including 
· officiating as the ranking on-site representative of the OPCW Technical Secretariat
· manage the inspection team to ensure that the aims of the inspection mandate are fulfilled
· negotiate with the inspected State Party through the use of diplomatic and technical negotiation skills to resolve issues that may arise during the mission.
· provide situation reports on the inspections progress
· act as the inspection teams point of contact for media, if required.
· analyse and interpret the various types of information gathered on site and its relevance to the aims of the mission. 
· Report the findings of the inspection on site, through the required Preliminary Findings Report (PF) or  Interim Report.
· Provide the PF and debrief the representatives of an ISP on the conclusion of an inspection.
3. Direct All Post Inspection Activities

B) Provide Technical Advice and Support to the Inspectorate and Other Units of the Technical Secretariat in relation to . 
· the transition to the post-destruction phase Inspectorate Division structure.
· supporting knowledge transfer and maintenance of CW expertise to the Inspectorate staff.
· directing and conduct lectures and/or practical exercises in support of the Technical Secretariat functions.
· advising and participating in negotiating teams and working groups in discussions with the state parties on various issues related to verification
· participating in bilateral visits to carry out OPCW mandate.

C) Undertake any Special Duties and Tasks as Directed by the DoI or DG.

profile_positions.company: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
profile_positions.description:
Under the supervision of the Director of the Inspectorate or an assigned Team Leader, the incumbent supports the operational planning and on-site execution of OPCW inspections at military
installations world-wide and performs the following duties:
1. Plans inspections by: assisting in pre-inspection planning through review and analysis of available information; supporting inspection preparations in relation to health and safety, logistical and administrative/confidentiality related matters.
2. Performs inspections by: analysing site records relevant to the inspections, relating to the storage or destruction of chemical weapons; verifying the type and inventory of chemical weapons; working in an environment containing large quantities of chemical weapons (e.g. bulk chemicals, munitions, devices and equipment) and their precursors, wearing required levels of protective  equipment; maintaining a safe working environment by using CWA detection and monitoring equipment, and assessing explosive hazards during the conduct of the inspection; verifying and monitoring the destruction of chemical weapons; setting-up, operating, and evaluating results of Non-Destructive Evaluation (NDE) techniques if required.
3. Reports on inspection activities by: contributing to the writing of final inspection reports; contributing to briefings to management on inspection related matters; maintaining confidentiality in relation to declaration and inspection related information.
4. Contribute to induction and refresher training for all OPCW staff, ensuring the achievement of minimum inspection and verification proficiency standards relevant to their work.
5. Performs other duties as required.
profile_positions.title: Inspector and OPCW Instructor (Chemical Weapons Munitions Specialist)

profile_positions.company: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
profile_positions.description:
1. Provide consultation and advice for staff regarding health and safety issues related to their work. 
  2. Provide advice and support to staff from other functional units who deal with administration of health and safety. 
  3. Contribute to induction and refresher training for all OPCW staff, ensuring the achievement of minimum health and safety proficiency standards relevant to their work. 
  4. Develop and conduct CW safety training and practical exercises relevant for the use of protective clothing and equipment, detection and monitoring, decontamination and specific topics. 
  5. Provide health and safety support for Organisational training activities (e.g. the Assistex series). 
  6. Review and monitor health and safety training provided by external sources for OPCW staff. 
  7. Provide advice and assistance regarding health and safety aspects of equipment. 
  8. Incorporate the principles of risk management into all applicable OPCW activities. 
  9. Assist the conduct of regular inspections of OPCW working premises, and health and safety equipment/procedures, reporting results to Management through the SSO. 
  10. Assist with the implementation of the health and safety program guided by the results of health and safety inspections, aimed at control of identified hazards to acceptable levels of risk. 
   11. Assess and respond to concerns raised by staff concerning health and safety aspects of their workplaces. 
   12. Assist with implementation of accident prevention initiatives. 
   13. Contribute to the investigation of accidents occurring in OPCW work areas, and make recommendations to prevent recurrence. 
   14. Inspection activities accomplished with minimal risk, in accordance with the OPCW’s health, safety and medical requirements.
